Character

Class PlayerCharacter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • Utility.Entity
        • Character.Character
          • Character.AttributeCharacter
            • Character.PlayerCharacter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Interactable, Moveable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class PlayerCharacter
extends AttributeCharacter
    The user-controlled player in the game. Holds information about the current inventory and quests, as well as some attributes. Can interact with other characters in the game and is able to use attacks.
    Version:
    2013-02-28
    Author:
    Alexander Persson & Jimmy Svensson
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • PlayerCharacter

        public PlayerCharacter(int id,
               int x,
               int y,
               int width,
               int height,
               java.lang.String name,
               int health,
               boolean isAttackable,
               int speed,
               int money,
               int maxInventorySize,
               int maxHealth)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        id - the id of a character
        x - the x coordination of a character
        y - the y coordination of a character
        width - the width of a character
        height - the height of a character
        name - the name of a character
        health - the health of a character
        isAttackable - if a character is attackable or not
        speed - the speed of a AttributeCharacter
        money - the money that the PlayerCharacter have
        maxInventorySize - the max size of an inventory
        maxHealth - the max health a PlayerCharacter can have

    • Method Detail

      • updateStatistics

        public void updateStatistics(java.lang.String type)
        Updates the statistics for the player. Depending on the string it will update different statistics.
        Parameters:
        type - "Monster" to update monsters, "Quest" to update quests.

      • getStatistics

        Returns the statistics for the player.
        Returns:

      • updateQuests

        public void updateQuests(java.lang.String name,
                PlayerCharacter p)
        Updates all the quests in the players questlog.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the quest part that needs to be updates.
        p - The player whose questlog to be updated.
